meanings.definition: The boundary line formed by a fence.
meanings.sent1: The fenceline separated the two properties.
meanings.sent2: I painted the fenceline to make it more visible.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel walked along the fenceline, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: The fenceline stood like a silent guardian, protecting the garden from intruders.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden fenceline creaked in the wind, telling stories of the past.

meanings.definition: To mark or protect with a fence.
meanings.sent1: We need to fenceline the garden to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to fenceline the entire field for security.
meanings.sent3: The kids fencelined their secret hideout with branches and twine.
meanings.sent4: She fencelined her heart after being hurt too many times.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew worked hard to fenceline the construction site before starting work.

meanings.definition: Along the line of a fence.
meanings.sent1: The cat walked fenceline, following the perimeter of the yard.
meanings.sent2: We placed the flowers fenceline to the wooden fence.
meanings.sent3: The dog ran fenceline, chasing after a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The children played fenceline, imagining they were on a grand adventure.
meanings.sent5: The hikers walked fenceline, enjoying the view of the countryside.
